answers.answer: Hi!Yes, gas, cramping etc can mean ovulation. However, they can also be due to IBS, Celiac Disease/Ulcerative Colitis/ Crohn’s disease, H pylori infection, diabetes, food intolerance, malabsorption syndromes, constipation, gallbladder and liver problems, pancreatic dysfunction, or taking a diet rich in sulfites. Chronic constipation can be due to diet poor in roughage or fiber, dehydration, diabetes, hypothyroidism, colon disorders, irritable bowel syndrome, diverticular diseases, cancers, severe acidity etc. It can also be due to milk allergy and other food allergies. Hence these causes need to be ruled out.I suggest you buy an ovulation kit and try close to your ovulation date. Home pregnancy tests will be negative before your next period date. Only if you miss your periods, take a pregnancy tes. After stopping pills, ovulation takes some time to regularize. Hence monitor ovulation with the kit, and try close to it.Discuss this with your gynecologist. Take care!
